trial_identification.studytitle: Assessment of Diabetes after Periodontal Treatment
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The effect of periodontal treatment and the use of a triclosan dentifrice on glycaemic control in diabetics

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Other diseases of the mouth, teeth, oesophagus, digestive system including liver and colon

interventions.interventions: Group1- periodontal treatment + random allocation to triclosan or non triclosan toothpaste. The response to treatment will be assessed at 2 weeks, 6 and 12 months.
interventions.comparator: Group 2- periodontal treatment after treatment for Group 1 is completed + random allocation to triclosan or non-triclosan toothpaste.

primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured at 6 and 12 months after treatment
Measured at 6 and 12 months after treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Response to periodontal treatment + any added benefit from triclosan toothpaste
Inflammatory markers, plaque bacteria & antibodies also assessed.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: HbA1c>6%, Able to give informed consent, Minimum of 12 teeth, Chronic periodontitis.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Pregnancy, Gross dental caries, Requirement of antibiotic cover for dental treatment, Anticoagulant therapy, other serious illness.

trial_design.concealment: Sealed opaque envelopes. As participants are recruited the next envelope in the sequence is opened and the participant asssigned accordingly.
trial_design.sequence: Computer generated random allocation using SPSS v11. subjects were randomly allocated to equal sized treatment groups and then randomly allocated to toothpaste type within the treatment groups.
